result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary D. Miles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 3:28 p.m. Defendant Zachary D. Miles in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, Defendant to obtain a HSED, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 2 days CFTS.  Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 mos, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-27-2015 03:15 pm

11:19 am case called. Defendant Zachary D. Miles in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests adjournment for defendant to be presented to the TAD panel. Court grants adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
